p: The findings for the effects of ZMEO on the percentage of wound contraction are shown in Figure 2. The results implied that topical administration of therapeutic ointments significantly ( p < 0.05) increased wound contraction rate on days 7 and 14 compared to the NCG group ( Figure 2(A,B)). The comparison between treatment groups revealed that a higher wound contraction rate was observed in the 4% ZMEO-treated group compared to the 2% ZMEO-treated and MG groups ( p < 0.05).
